commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Switch to using 'Hair Space' for menu selection control
commits.body: This changes the previously zero-width whitespace character used to control the menu item selected when typing a C with the menu open. The previous workaround became very visible on Yosemite, a hair space isn't absolutely invisible but almost so.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Let Subversion → Checkout fallback on home folder
commits.body: If TM_DIRECTORY is unset then TM_FILEPATH would also be unset, causing an exception (dirname being called with nil).

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Let actions in status window call the proper scripts
commits.body:
Previously revert, remove, and commit would all fail, fixes textmate/subversion.tmbundle#12

It seems that the status window code is from the old bundle, prior to the major refactoring done, and while new scripts had been created for the actions, no one was actually calling them.

I also removed setting ‘LC_CTYPE’ as that should no longer be an issue, additionally we now recommend calling ‘mate’ via the TM_MATE environment variable.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Revert "Fix for the diff action in the commit window"

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Fix for the diff action in the commit window
commits.body:
Starting with mate 2.5 it will not read from standard input if the TM_DOCUMENT_UUID environment variable is set. This is unfortunate for commands launched by TextMate (where the variable is set) that use mate to pass data to TextMate (via mate’s stdin).

This fix is provisional until a new version of mate gets released.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Improve the “Find Next Conflict” macro bound to <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌃|</kbd>
commits.body: Pressing <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌃|</kbd> when already at the start of a merge conflict will now find the next merge conflict (previously it would find the merge conflict “at the caret”).

commits.summary: Use 1.8 of ruby in a few missed places

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Pass nil instead of an empty string if TM_SVN_DIFF_CMD is unset
commits.body: Passing an empty string broke the ability to diff a single file and it rather diffed the entire project. Fixes issue raised in #8 and textmate/textmate#899.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Allow ‘@’ in filenames for Add, Commit, and Log
commits.body:
Doing a complete fix (for all commands) is very complicated as there is no ideal place to add this escaping.

Ideally we would escape at the level where we pass the paths to ‘svn’, but the current API simply provide an argument array that may contain things other than paths, and the commit window can also call ‘svn’ (e.g. for add and diff).

Given the decreased use of subversion and the rarity of ‘@’ in paths, I don’t think it’s worth investing the time to overhaul the bundle to better handle this issue.

Fixes #5.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.body: This is a no-op with TextMate 2.0.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.body:
All paths passed to the svn command line tool should go through this function. Presently the only thing it does is to append a ‘@’ to the filename if the filename already contains one. This is required because subversion cuts any suffix matching /@[^@]*$/ and treats that as shorthand for the revision argument (-r).

Ideally svn would have an option to disable this behavior.
